You know, I would have been really happy if the Church said it was ok for a new gal to join me in the bedroom every night over the last 20 years, whether my wife liked it or not.  Spiritually, I'm not so sure how I'd see that as a good thing, even if the Church said it was ok.  My marriage has its ups and downs, as all do, but my wife and I made a commitment to love one another.  Some of the most fulfilling moments in my marriage have been when my wife and I have resolved a seemingly "irreconcilable" difference.  

Christ commanded us to love one another, so I don't quite get this notion of "loveless marriage."  Well, actually, I do: it's a misconception of what love is.  It's funny, because it seems that modern notions of love are formed from tv/film/book portrayals, whereas real love is exhibited by moms and dads.  Which is another reason why both parents in a loving marriage are really important for children's lives.

I knew if I read down far enough I would see Raymond Burke's name, and something linking him to the Correction -- even if it is to say Burke had not (yet) signed the document.
I always enjoy NCR, but I repeat what I have said before -- that whenever there's not enough news, NCR will find something that arouses the anti-Burke readership.  
Luther, of course, wrote one of the earliest Correction-type documents -- those 95 Theses that he nailed to the church door -- and it is ironic that Burke and his followers see themselves on the side of the popes against whom the Reformers protested!

"that freed blacks owned more slaves than whites before the Civil War;"
I believe the argument is that proportionally freed blacks owned more slaves.  A very small minority of southern whites owned slaves and freed blacks were a much smaller minority of the population than that. So in absolute terms whites owned more slaves but in terms of relative numbers freed blacks were more slave owning than the majority whites.  I doubt Mr. Wilson made this distinction but would rather misrepresent the facts to support his Frankfurt School Marxist/Racist perspective.

It is also interesting to note that the first slave owner in the colonies was a black man. Sorry Marxists, your whites are evil narrative is not true and fundamentally racist.
